content.description: Climb the short arete starting matched on the good crimps. Easy to not dab on the rock with good beta. Unsure if this has a name. Felt about V3. You can probably start even further right if you're really motivated.
content.location: On the rock close to the trail. Opposite of FF Crack.

content.description:
Start matched on the large undercling with less than desirable feet. Get your hands up in a way that works for you, then mantle onto the sloping bulge. There aren't many hand choices for the mantle so trust your feet.

Starting in the undercling is really awkward, kind of detracts from the route but is also entertaining in a terrible sort of way. Probably V0/1 if you just do the mantle. Worth doing only if you have exhausted all the better climbs in this area.

This had the moss brushed off it already so assuming people have climbed it. Let me know if you know the name.
content.location: Just to the right (around the tree) of unknown arete directly on the trail. Or a bit left from Kermit the Frog/FF crack.

content.description:
Start with right hand on sharp pinch on right side of arete, left hand on good edge on other side of arete, and pretty much no feet. Make big move to an edge at the top of the arete and then top out with high feet. Very short, one-move problem.

This

is the only place where I could find a name for this problem.
content.location:
From Indian Rock parking, hike north along the Skyline Trail past the main Nature Nazi bouldering area. Not too long after that, there will be a few boulders off to the left. This problem is on the largest boulder in that cluster. It is on the arete to the left of

Naked Nazi Arete

.

content.description: Start with one or both hands in the chalked up crater-looking pocket, and go up the face.
content.location: Left of "slab", opposite side of funky face and funky arete.

content.description: Absolutely heinous sloper slab traverse. Start about 15 feet right of the lieback flake and traverse left on the slopey arete on barely there slopers. Crux is the first couple of moves! After the first couple of moves you can gain the good undercling and topout on the lieback flake or continue higher on slopers the whole way (V??)
content.location: Left of the descent ramp for nature Nazi arete, right of the lieback flake.

content.description: Start on a great foot and climb the slab. Eliminating the arete adds a grade or two.
content.location: Opposite of Funky Face on the same boulder.

content.description: Sit start and climb the arete. Mantle directly or turn the corner (V2)
content.location: If you walk back down the road to a small trail entrance off the highway the boulder is up on the hill before the entrance

content.description:
Sit start on the sloper part of the arete. Work your hands up along the arete until a reachy move to a good hueco left. Finish with a typical, slopey mantle.

Found in Clay Breitweiser's Castle Rock Bouldering guidebook.
content.location: From Indian Rock parking, hike north along the Skyline Trail past the main Nature Nazi bouldering area. Not too long after that, there will be a few boulders off to the left. This problem is on the largest boulder in that cluster.

content.description: This is the slab to the right of naked nazi arête with a low start in a big jug next to a small tree. Make a couple powerful moves up onto the slab then climb straight up to a nice rail like chicken head on the top. It's a very technical problem where your feet are everything after the first few moves. It's a bit high so be careful.
content.location: This is the slab to the right of naked nazi arête.

content.description: This climbs the face on the boulder to the right of "Slab". Climb the center of the boulder without using the arete. Limited features of the face make this interesting. I saw this listed as V2, and am posting it as such, but felt it was more like a V1.
content.location: This is on the boulder to the right of "Slab", and to the left of the boulder with "Man in the Canoe".

content.description: Start left on the arete and move onto the face and left to finish.
content.location: Just right of Nature Nazi Arete on the same boulder.

content.description: Climb the obvious flake then traverse right.
content.location: Opposite from Nature Nazi Traverse on same boulder.

content.description: Climb the face using tiny protruding knobs. Arete is off.
content.location: Just right of Funky Arete and FF Crack.

content.description: Climb the chimney on Funky Face boulder
Climb the arete.
content.location: Just right of FF crack. Left immediately of the trail.

content.description: Move right to left on the large split boulder. You'll likely come out cut, scratched, and bruised. A great time!
content.location: On the left next to the trail.

content.description: Start on the sidepull, make a move right then up.
content.location: On the rock opposite Lieback Flake and Slab. Facing the road.

content.description:
start stand start in middle of face and nature nazi traverse and join nature nazi traverse. Starts with high foot on jug.

The sit start goes at V8
Climb the arete on the right side, without using any face holds.
content.location: To the right of "slab", left of minimalism.

content.description: Starts on the crimp in the middle of the face. Goes up and right working you're way out and over through the big undercling.

First arete you see when you walk up. More than 1 pad is nice because of a rocky landing.

The sit start goes at V10

Starts low and to the left on the shortest part of the boulder, make your way rightward along the sloping lip, move through the insecure crux bulge and top out at some good jugs just before the large tree. A long and burly line.
content.location: Located to the left of Nature Nazi arete, the obvious long sloping rail.

content.description: Sit start in cave and traverse into the V4 variation.
